```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE,warning = FALSE)

library(nlme)
library(robustlmm)
library(geoR)

data <- read.csv("B:\\Projects\\Vira Kravets\\T-Tswap-Median,% - Fig2C.csv")
data$um <- NULL
colnames(data) <- c("islet","initial","repeated","distance")
data$l_initial <- log(data$initial+0.0001)

mod <- lme(repeated ~ l_initial,random=~1|islet,data = data)
resid <- residuals(mod)
pred <- predict(mod)
data_with_pred <- cbind(data,pred)
data_with_pred$l_initial <- ifelse(data_with_pred$l_initial<0,0,data_with_pred$l_initial)

plot(data_with_pred$l_initial,data_with_pred$repeated)
abline(data_with_pred$pred,data_with_pred$repeated)

write.csv(resid,"B:\\Projects\\Vira Kravets\\residuals.csv",row.names = F)

write.csv(data_with_pred,"B:\\Projects\\Vira Kravets\\data_with_predicted_values.csv",row.names = F)
```

```{r echo=FALSE, comment=""}
summary(mod)
```

Interpretation of model above: for a 1% increase in initial, repeated increases by `r summary(mod)$tTable[2,1]/100`%.

```{r echo=FALSE, comment=""}
qqnorm(mod,abline = c(0,1))
shapiro.test(resid(mod))
```
